feature.title: Rheumatology
feature.body: The Stanmore Rheumatology unit comprises of a unique mix of skills and specialities that includes a bespoke inpatient service for complex regional pain syndrome and hyper mobility, the only one in the UK. Our Sport and Exercise Medicine service includes the only NHS clinic dedicated to dance medicine, specialist study and treatment of rare conditionsÂ as well as metabolic bone diseases and genetic/paediatric conditions.

content.title: Complex Rheumatology / Pain
content.body: The complex regional pain syndrome service offers outpatient appointments as well as an inpatient rehabilitation programme (The aim of rehabilitation programmes is to improve your physical abilities and independence in day to day living).

content.title: General Rheumatology
content.body: This includes inflammatory & degenerative arthritis, connective tissue disease, soft tissue rheumatism and back pain.

content.title: Sports & Exercise Medicine
content.body: Sports injuries often occur as a result of errors in training and activity and can often be prevented by understanding how the body responds to exercise. Most injuries can be treated by applying relative rest, physical therapy and the principles of rehabilitation. Occasionally orthoses, medication and injections are required.

content.title: Joint Hyper mobility Service
content.body: This service offers outpatient service and an inpatient rehabilitation programme (The aim of rehabilitation programmes is to improve your physical abilities and independence in day to day living).

content.title: The Team
content.body: We run a multidisciplinary team including orthopaedic surgeons, clinical nurse specialists, physiotherapists, occupational therapists and psychologists.
